Key Match Events: Cristian Javier got one out and was removed from the game after allowing three runs and four hits in the first inning.
Corey Seager launched a fastball 440 feet into the second deck in right field for a home run.
Evan Carter walked and stole second base before scoring on a single by Adolis García that caromed off the wall in left field.
Jonah Heim put runners at the corners with a sharp single to left, and Javier was removed by Baker.
France surrendered a two-run double to Evan Carter and a two-run single by García.
Bregman hit a solo homer in the bottom of the third to close the gap to 4-2.
Pre-Game Insights: Houston manager Dusty Baker takes starting pitcher Cristian Javier out of the game during the first inning of Game 6 of the baseball AL Championship Series against the Texas Rangers Monday, Oct. 23, 2023, in Houston.
Post-Match Reflections: Dusty Baker said, “We have been spoiled around here as far as winning and winning and winning, and heck, I’ve been here four years, and we’ve been to two World Series and two Championship Series. We have nothing to be ashamed of or nothing to hold our head down about. We’re down, but we’re not out. And every team in baseball would trade to have had the last four years that we’ve had.”
Alex Bregman said, “We didn’t execute as well as we have in years past. … It comes down to execution, and we didn’t do a good enough job of that, and they did,”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros are the only big league team to lose four home games in a seven-game postseason series, falling against Washington in the 2019 World Series and then experiencing the same issue this year versus Texas.
No team with a losing record at home has ever reached the World Series.
Others: J.P. France got two outs after Javier's removal, marking the end of Houston's title defense.

Catcher Martín Maldonado addressed the right-hander's struggles, saying, “His command wasn’t great. His off-speed pitches weren’t sharp. I feel like they had a good game plan against him. Other than that, I felt like his (velocity) was up. Even in the bullpen, it felt like he was a little harder than what it used to be. I don’t know. Probably doing too much.”
